Trying it out now, but it seems like the JobJarMaker is does not package the Launcher class into the JAR, so the job fails to start on HDInsight. Am I missing anything here? The classes-{*}.jar uploaded only contains files from org.apache.examples, without any of the classes required to Launch the job.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #473](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/473/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
You probably need to run the example from the command line, without Maven.
Great, that worked. Thanks!
Does that mean that you were able to run things on HDInsight?
Yes, I was able to submit HelloHDInsight, and verified the output on the cluster.

A problem I found was that I was not able to submit to an HDInsight cluster if I was not on a Windows machine, since the submission detects the OS you're submitting from and builds the java classpath based on the submission OS instead of the execution OS. HDInsight only takes the classpath separator ";", while UNIX based clusters only take ":", so Windows machines won't be able to submit jobs to a UNIX-based cluster either. Perhaps the classpath should build built based on a configuration instead of detecting the submission OS?

Yes, that is a known problem: [REEF-63](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-63). 
However, in the case of HDI, we always submit _to_ Windows, so we should be able to get away with a specifc encoding.

> Perhaps the classpath should build built based on a configuration instead of detecting the submission OS?

That is what we do today via the `ClassPathProvider` classes.
@dkm2110 I've done another pass. My main concern lies with the missing encapsulation within the `WritableNsMessage` class.
@yingdachen @jwang98052 do you think this is safe to merge now?

Does it work if the submission is done from something other than Windows? If not, we should at least file a JIRA on it and link it from REEF-63. Back when we first introduced the HDI support, it did work from UNIX.
